TopicTitle: A few questions from a rookie

Articles.Content:
1. I've tried messing with the resolution, I saw some posts on reddit and the steam forums, that the game supports multiple monitors. However when ever I try setting a 5760x1080, the game itself dosn't change, however in the settings menu in-game, it sets it to 1024x768 but only in the displayed text the actual resolution is 1920x1080. Any explanation to this, or tips as to get it working ? (GPU: Asus Radeon 7870 @ 2Gb)

2. When ever I do a time-warp of more than 50x, I somehow loose control of my SAS when I exit it, in the way that I become unable to activate/deactivate it. This happens with all crafts and no matter the settings I use. However a friend of mine never sees this, even if we built the exact same crafts. ??? (Please note that, this occurs after the time-warp is complete. Only way for me to fix it, has been to reload the level.)

Sry if this one seems confusing, but I've tried to spell it out...

3. I've seen people on youtube using the structural panels, where they are able to get them to curve/bend in the opposite direction of eachother (While using the symmetry mode), however I only seem to be able to have them move in the same direction.

Example:

Youtube - /o\ - @0:45 - 0:52

Me - /o/

Where ' / ' is a panel and ' o is a cylinder.

3. I've seen people on youtube using the structural panels, where they are able to get them to curve/bend in the opposite direction of eachother (While using the symmetry mode), however I only seem to be able to have them move in the same direction.

You can change the orientation in smaller steps, when you use WASD and Shift.

2. When ever I do a time-warp of more than 50x, I somehow loose control of my SAS when I exit it, in the way that I become unable to activate/deactivate it. This happens with all crafts and no matter the settings I use. However a friend of mine never sees this, even if we built the exact same crafts. ??? (Please note that, this occurs after the time-warp is complete. Only way for me to fix it, has been to reload the level.)

Has your craft a way to generate power? Without power all reaction wheels will stop working. If power is not the problem: Are you sure you are completely out of timewarp?

You can change the orientation in smaller steps, when you use WASD and Shift.

I'm aware of the use of shift + WASD, however that's not the issue.

Has your craft a way to generate power? Without power all reaction wheels will stop working. If power is not the problem: Are you sure you are completely out of timewarp?

It's got both solar panels and the thermal generator, so it should have enough juice to generate. As the only thing using power by my knowledge on the craft is the SAS. (and yes, it does have a batteries)...

After double checking, yes. I am complete out of time-warp.

Youtube - /o\

Me - /o/

If you are building it in VAB like the clip on YouTube then I believe you placed your initial module horizontally.

I don't know if this is what you're talking about, but I've noticed weirdness with two-way symmetry in the VAB. Sometimes it misbehaves in ways it didn't used to.

For example, I had a pair of side tanks attached with decouplers to a center tank, placed with two-way symmetry on. Then it's just a simple matter of running a fuel line from one of the side tanks to the center one, and the other tank gets the same hookup. But lately I've seen cases where the fuel line thinks the symmetry is centered on the one tank I'm working with, and places a fuel line on both sides of it. The only way I can make it behave is by attaching it, then detaching and trying again. Then the symmetry works properly. Weird!
